title: harmony_automation
text:
As I am the main person responsible for data updates for Sears, there can be upwards of 100+ tickets/logs to process on a bi-weekly basis. Some logs can be closed after the update process, while others need to be re-assigned for further processing.
The update process has been streamlined to the point that updates can be easily and quickly completed in bulk/batches. Manually closing and re-assigning up to 100+ logs at a time proved to be a tedious hassle, so I created some scripts to automate the process using Selenium.

import os
import sys
import time

import pandas as pd
from loguru import logger as lg

from harmony_automation import bots

title: 03_scripts
text:
fxs


Code
# * DOC
def load_data() -> pd.DataFrame:
    """Load and clean one of the output files created from the update script - `for_log_tracker_...xlsx`. Warn if ticket # is missing.
    Returns
    -------
    pd.DataFrame
        df w/ 2 columns: `ticket_num` and `log_action`
    """
    latest = sorted(os.listdir(("../dat")))[-1]
    lg.info(f"Latest log tracker file: {latest}")

    df = pd.read_excel((f"../dat/{latest}"))
    df = df[["ticket_num", "death_update"]].copy()
    df.columns = ["ticket_num", "log_action"]

    m = df.ticket_num.isna()
    if len(df[m]) > 0:
        lg.warning("Missing ticket numbers in data")

    return df.copy()

title: 03_scripts
text:
run


Code
# * DOC
df = load_data()
bot = bots.Bot()
sys.exit(0)



close logs


Code
# * DOC
# filter for only logs to close
lg.trace("## Closing Logs")
m = df["log_action"].str.strip().str.lower() == "n"
logs_to_close = df[m].copy()
logs_to_close = [str(x) for x in logs_to_close.ticket_num.tolist()]

lg.info(f"# logs to close: {len(logs_to_close)}")
completed_list = []




Code
# * DOC
for i in range(len(logs_to_close)):
    ticket_num = logs_to_close[i]
    remaining = len(logs_to_close) - (i + 1)
    lg.trace(f"idx: {i} // remaining: {remaining} // ticket #: {ticket_num}")

    if ticket_num not in completed_list:
        res = bot.close_log(ticket_num)
        ctr = 0

        while (res != 0) and (ctr < 10):
            time.sleep(0.5)
            res = bot.close_log(ticket_num)
            ctr += 1

        if res == 0:
            completed_list.append(ticket_num)
            lg.trace(f"closed {ticket_num}")
        else:
            lg.warning(f"error closing {ticket_num}; manual check needed")
            raise Exception("manual check needed")




re-assign


Code
# * DOC
# filter for only logs to re-assign
lg.trace("## Re-assigning Logs")
m = df["log_action"].str.strip().str.lower() != "n"
logs_to_reassign: pd.DataFrame = df[m].copy()
logs_to_reassign = logs_to_reassign.reset_index(drop=True).copy()

lg.info(f"# logs to re-assign: {len(logs_to_reassign)}")
reassigned_list: list[str] = []




Code
# * DOC
for i in range(len(logs_to_reassign)):
    ticket_num = str(logs_to_reassign.loc[i]["ticket_num"])
    note = str(logs_to_reassign.loc[i]["log_action"])
    remaining = len(logs_to_reassign) - (i + 1)
    lg.trace(f"idx: {i} // remaining: {remaining} // ticket #: {ticket_num}")

    if ticket_num not in reassigned_list:
        _ok = False
        ctr = 0

        while not _ok:
            try:
                bot.search_ticket_num(ticket_num)
                bot.reassign_log(note)
                time.sleep(1.8)
            except:
                time.sleep(1)
                lg.warning(f"retrying {ticket_num}")
                ctr += 1
                if ctr > 10:
                    raise Exception("manual check required")
            else:
                reassigned_list.append(ticket_num)
                lg.trace(f"re-assigned {ticket_num} w/ note: {note}")
                _ok = True




Code
# * DOC
bot.shutdown()
